@philip_l_g wrote:

its like predicting whne you next fart or somthing although i think im gonna fart really soon… i think the earth will end when the sun dies wich is possible but then we would have all ivolved and we would be living on jupiter and even in the sun did dye it would explode making a big bang (bigger than when you stamp your feet :3) making the universe expand and light alot of planets on fire and they will all join together and the people living in a different galaxy will watch and laugh saying im glad i didnt stay on earth then i will whip out my poket size planet disintergrator and disintergrate their asses fart

item.title: Giant asteroid could hit Earth in 2014?
item.dc:creator: @PaulT PaulT
item.description:
@PaulT wrote:

[quote=“doomsday, post:29, topic:3354”][quote author=PaulT link=topic=3948.msg40788#msg40788 date=1149003480]

wow the guy is a noob, as you see in the end as the tuturle dude goes 1/2 your speed there for you will catch up with him in…15 meters…

The turtle moves about 1/10 of the speed of Achilles.

Suppose, began the Tortoise, that you give me a 10-meter head start. Would you say that you could cover that 10 meters between us very quickly?
Very quickly, Achilles affirmed.
And in that time, how far should I have gone, do you think?
Perhaps a meter  no more, said Achilles after a moment’s thought.[/quote]

Therefore, by the time Achilles has walked 15 meters, the turtle will have walked 1.5, therefore creating a new distance for Achilles to cross. When you have walked 1.5, the turtle will have walked a massive .15. As long as the turtle has a headstart, he will always be ahead.

so after he wen the .15 then the turtle would have gone .015

then after he went .015 the turtle would have gone .0015, and so one, beside you know hwo small .0015 is i can easly sprint ahead of you right there, i mean for havens sake, if you go 1/10 my speed then 9/10 of a meter ill will be ahead, so i would still win[/quote]

You haven’t proved you would ever catch the turtle, just that you would reduce the distance between you to a very small amount. You would still never pass the turtle, even if the distance between you became a tiny number.

Read full topic

item.title: Giant asteroid could hit Earth in 2014?
item.dc:creator: @ipl0x ipl0x
item.description:
@ipl0x wrote:

[quote=“doomsday, post:24, topic:3354”][quote author=ipl0x link=topic=3948.msg40545#msg40545 date=1148957034]

Correct, but if you think about it, every years is like 360+(-) years, so that is (too lazy to click calculator).

I guess your saying every unit of time has it’s own unique probabilities of any event occuring, but that’s not really true. Infinite divisiblity does not work:

[quote]The Tortoise challenged Achilles to a race, claiming that he would win as long as Achilles gave him a small head start. Achilles laughed at this, for of course he was a mighty warrior and swift of foot, whereas the Tortoise was heavy and slow.
How big a head start do you need? he asked the Tortoise with a smile.
Ten meters, the latter replied.
Achilles laughed louder than ever. You will surely lose, my friend, in that case, he told the Tortoise, but let us race, if you wish it.
On the contrary, said the Tortoise, I will win, and I can prove it to you by a simple argument.
Go on then, Achilles replied, with less confidence than he felt before. He knew he was the superior athlete, but he also knew the Tortoise had the sharper wits, and he had lost many a bewildering argument with him before this.
Suppose, began the Tortoise, that you give me a 10-meter head start. Would you say that you could cover that 10 meters between us very quickly?
Very quickly, Achilles affirmed.
And in that time, how far should I have gone, do you think?
Perhaps a meter  no more, said Achilles after a moment’s thought.
Very well, replied the Tortoise, so now there is a meter between us. And you would catch up that distance very quickly?
Very quickly indeed!
And yet, in that time I shall have gone a little way farther, so that now you must catch that distance up, yes?

Ye-es, said Achilles slowly.
And while you are doing so, I shall have gone a little way farther, so that you must then catch up the new distance, the Tortoise continued smoothly.
Achilles said nothing.
And so you see, in each moment you must be catching up the distance between us, and yet I  at the same time  will be adding a new distance, however small, for you to catch up again.
Indeed, it must be so, said Achilles wearily.
And so you can never catch up, the Tortoise concluded sympathetically.
You are right, as always, said Achilles sadly  and conceded the race.[/quote]

So your point is that nothing will happen without giving a warning first?
[/quote]

wow the guy is a noob, as you see in the end as the tuturle dude goes 1/2 your speed there for you will catch up with him in…15 meters…

achillies was a noob who doesnt know math[/quote]

rofl, I didn’t read the story, too long, no time.

Read full topic

wow the guy is a noob, as you see in the end as the tuturle dude goes 1/2 your speed there for you will catch up with him in....15 meters....

The turtle moves about 1/10 of the speed of Achilles.

â€œSuppose,â€ began the Tortoise, â€œthat you give me a 10-meter head start. Would you say that you could cover that 10 meters between us very quickly?â€ â€œVery quickly,â€ Achilles affirmed. â€œAnd in that time, how far should I have gone, do you think?â€ â€œPerhaps a meter â€“ no more,â€ said Achilles after a moment's thought.

Therefore, by the time Achilles has walked 15 meters, the turtle will have walked 1.5, therefore creating a new distance for Achilles to cross. When you have walked 1.5, the turtle will have walked a massive .15. As long as the turtle has a headstart, he will always be ahead.

item.title: Giant asteroid could hit Earth in 2014?
item.dc:creator: @doomsday doomsday
item.description:
@doomsday wrote:

[quote=“ipl0x, post:22, topic:3354”][quote author=PaulT link=topic=3948.msg40526#msg40526 date=1148956216]

Correct, but if you think about it, every years is like 360+(-) years, so that is (too lazy to click calculator).

I guess your saying every unit of time has it’s own unique probabilities of any event occuring, but that’s not really true. Infinite divisiblity does not work:

[quote]The Tortoise challenged Achilles to a race, claiming that he would win as long as Achilles gave him a small head start. Achilles laughed at this, for of course he was a mighty warrior and swift of foot, whereas the Tortoise was heavy and slow.
How big a head start do you need? he asked the Tortoise with a smile.
Ten meters, the latter replied.
Achilles laughed louder than ever. You will surely lose, my friend, in that case, he told the Tortoise, but let us race, if you wish it.
On the contrary, said the Tortoise, I will win, and I can prove it to you by a simple argument.
Go on then, Achilles replied, with less confidence than he felt before. He knew he was the superior athlete, but he also knew the Tortoise had the sharper wits, and he had lost many a bewildering argument with him before this.
Suppose, began the Tortoise, that you give me a 10-meter head start. Would you say that you could cover that 10 meters between us very quickly?
Very quickly, Achilles affirmed.
And in that time, how far should I have gone, do you think?
Perhaps a meter  no more, said Achilles after a moment’s thought.
Very well, replied the Tortoise, so now there is a meter between us. And you would catch up that distance very quickly?
Very quickly indeed!
And yet, in that time I shall have gone a little way farther, so that now you must catch that distance up, yes?

Ye-es, said Achilles slowly.
And while you are doing so, I shall have gone a little way farther, so that you must then catch up the new distance, the Tortoise continued smoothly.
Achilles said nothing.
And so you see, in each moment you must be catching up the distance between us, and yet I  at the same time  will be adding a new distance, however small, for you to catch up again.
Indeed, it must be so, said Achilles wearily.
And so you can never catch up, the Tortoise concluded sympathetically.
You are right, as always, said Achilles sadly  and conceded the race.[/quote]
[/quote]

So your point is that nothing will happen without giving a warning first?[/quote]

wow the guy is a noob, as you see in the end as the tuturle dude goes 1/2 your speed there for you will catch up with him in…15 meters…

achillies was a noob who doesnt know math

â€œVery quickly indeed!â€
â€œAnd yet, in that time I shall have gone a little way farther, so that now you must catch that distance up, yes?â€

â€œYe-es,â€ said Achilles slowly.
